thread.title: NYT Report Confirms Media Silence On Rape Case Involving Illegal Immigrant
thread.title_full: NYT Report Confirms Media Silence On Rape Case Involving Illegal Immigrant

author: Jack Davis
title: NYT Report Confirms Media Silence On Rape Case Involving Illegal Immigrant
text:
NYT Report Confirms Media Silence On Rape Case Involving Illegal Immigrant "That is beyond anything I have ever seen ..." by Jack Davis March 27, 2017 at 8:27am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
The New York Times has seconded an assessment by Fox News host Bill O’Reilly and others at Fox that the mainstream media failed to sufficiently cover the alleged rape of a 14-year-old Maryland girl by two male students, at least one of whom was in the country illegally. 
“ABC, NBC, CBS did not cover it on their nightly news broadcasts,”‘Reilly said on The O’Reilly Factor . “CNN did not cover the Maryland story in primetime last night. Ditto MSNBC. That is beyond anything I have ever seen in my 40 years-plus of journalism to have a story of that magnitude ignored by the national media.” 
Reporters from the Times spent 18 hours on Thursday at Fox News and then wrote an in-depth report about the popular news channel. During the visit, Fox News hosts repeatedly called out the media for their silence on the Rockville, Md., case. Advertisement - story continues below Major Networks Ignore Alleged Rape By Illegal Immigrants 
The Times examined the claims by Fox hosts that other networks did not cover the incident in a fact-checking feature that ran with Saturday’s story. 
In its report, the Times admitted the case was one “viewers would not have heard about if they had turned to CNN or MSNBC,” later saying it “went virtually uncovered on most networks.” 
The alleged incident took place last Thursday . Henry E. Sanchez, 18, and Jose O. Montano, 17, were both charged with rape after a 14-year-old ninth-grade girl said she was forcefully taken into a bathroom in the Rockville, Md., high school and brutally raped. After the student’s arrest, police reported that Sanchez had an immigration case pending against him since August. Advertisement - story continues below 
“Fox hosts repeatedly pointed out the lack of coverage by other major networks of an alleged rape of a high school student in Maryland. While several affiliates in the area did cover the incident, none of the major TV networks dedicated sustained coverage to the rape case,” the Times fact-checker reported. 
The Times noted the way Fox hosts disparaged the silence of other media outlets. 
Tucker Carlson, host of Tucker Carlson Tonight , said other media outlets were “determined to ignore it.” 
“In my mind, they’re telling our little girls that this little girl’s life doesn’t matter as much as these illegal immigrants’ lives matter because they don’t want to spread a negative story,” said Fox & Friends co-host Ainsley Earhardt. Advertisement - story continues below
